sentence.Network_en: Some minerals, Pough ex-plained to my mystification, are not truly black but only look so.
sentence.Network_cn: 看我迷惑不解，珀夫解释说一些矿物质并非真的是黑色，只是看起来是黑色的。

sentence.Network_en: Smith looked round in some mystification.
sentence.Network_cn: 史密斯困惑不解地四下张望.

sentence.Network_en: The monarchy mystifies, no doubt of that - in the full sense of the term " mystification " .
sentence.Network_cn: 毫无疑问,君主制给人们以神秘感.这是货真价实的 神秘感.

PerfectNetExp.abs: John Berger 以神秘化(mystification)与复制 11 来表徵这个现象。他举一位艺术史学者对十六世纪荷兰画家Frans Hals 一幅作品构图方.
mysticism 神秘mystification 神秘mystify 变幻线
爱伦·坡_互动百科 ... 瘟疫王 King Pest 故弄玄虚（mystification） Mystification 丽姬娅 Ligeia.
...和相对性( relativity) ; ( 4)与神秘性(mystification)和神圣性( sanctification)对立, 表明世俗性( secular) 和日常生活性( eve.

entry.tran: 使困惑不解;使大为惊奇
entry.def: If you are mystified by something, you find it impossible to explain or understand.

example.ex: The audience must have been totally mystified by the plot...
example.tran: 观众一定是让剧情完全搞晕了。

example.ex: There was something strange in her attitude which mystified me.
example.tran: 她态度有些奇怪，让我迷惑不解。

means.word_mean: 1. confusion resulting from failure to understand
2. something designed to mystify or bewilder
3. the activity of obscuring people's understanding, leaving them baffled or bewildered

auth_sentence.content: Deliberate mystification is a common tactic of autocrats.
auth_sentence.res_content: Deliberate mystification is a common tactic of autocrats.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Deliberate mystification is a common tactic of autocrats.

auth_sentence.content: His default demeanor was equable mystification.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: His default demeanor was equable mystification.

auth_sentence.content: Mystification, he said, leads us to exaggerate threats and ignore costs.
auth_sentence.res_content: Mystification, he said, leads us to exaggerate threats and ignore costs.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Mystification, he said, leads us to exaggerate threats and ignore costs.
